website_summaries.verdict: The perfect model for anyone wanting the option of having a large, portable clock for a wall or desk.
pros: Divides the day into five cycles for people struggling to differentiate between morning and evening
Clocks comes with a battery backup in the case of a power outage
cons: Customers wish this clock had an alarm feature

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Face, but...
customer_reviews.text: A pretty, useful face = three stars. Timekeeping = 0. The clock loses approximately one minute per week. This clock is plugged into a decent 120 volt 60 cps domestic power line. Circuitry to drive a clock from 60 cycles/second is an inexpensive no-brainer. All my other inexpensive clocks are good to +/- 1 minute per six months.
customer_reviews.author: brutus inquisitor

customer_reviews.title: Love it...not just for seniors...
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my 90 yr old mother who was using the daily newspaper solely to orient herself for the day...calendars don't work if they can't determine the day. I love that this clock also gives the "part" of the day, especially when seniors take a nap and wake up, they don't know what time of day it is. I'm not 90 but I'm thinking about getting this clock for myself as is everyone I've shown it to.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Really helps my mom keep days and time of day straight
customer_reviews.text: This clock has reduced the problems my 88-year-old mother has been having keeping the days straight. It's also been a blessing because it notes the time of day: in Ohio in December, it's dark at 6 AM and 6 PM, and Mom was getting really confused. I've put one upstairs in her bedroom and another downstairs in a central location. The one in her bedroom "coordinates" with her 31-days-of-the-month pill box, so it helps with pill-taking, too. The day-to-day of dealing with a loved one's dementia can wear one down--no matter how much one loves the person--and even little helps like this clock provide relief. Thanks so much for developing and marketing it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Chaucer

customer_reviews.title: Great clock for memory impaired or orientation impaired
customer_reviews.text: This is the best dementia clock out there. There are many similar clocks, but this is the only one that says it is "BEFORE DAWN" after midnight and not "morning" or "night". My elderly mother gets up at 2:30am and if it said morning on the clock she would get dressed for the day. Pre dawn let's her know it's not time to get up. Everyone at her memory care unit commented how wonderful it is.

customer_reviews.title: Help put your loved ones mind at ease

I can only imagine how confusing and frustrating it must be to not remember the things that once were no effort to recall. I highly recommend it for anyone caring for a loved one living with the challenges that come with Dementia/Alzheimer’s.

customer_reviews.title: DayClox
customer_reviews.text: I ordered DayClox for my friend who has memory loss and it has totally changed her life and mine. Before DayClox I would receive between 5-8 calls a day asking what day it was and where she was suppose to go that day. With DayClox sitting on her kitchen table next to a large calendar she always knows what month, day and time it is. We filled in her calendar with her weekly events and now it's easy for her to look at her DayClox at the date then checking her calendar to see what she needs to do that day. She loves it. Highly recommended for people with moderate memory loss.

product_meta.title: DayClox Updated Memory Loss Digital Calendar Day Clock with Day Cycles & Battery Backup
product_meta.description: What makes this DayClox memory loss digital calendar day cycle clock so unique is that both the day and the month are fully spelled out, along with the cycle of the day! Many elders suffering from memory loss due to stroke, dementia, Alzheimer's or just advancing years, may have difficulty processing abbreviated words. Most clocks available today will abbreviate the month & the day. For example, November becomes Nov & February is Feb. The same is true for days of the week - Wednesday, is often displayed as Wed & Saturday as sat. This may be fine for the rest of the population, but for our loved ones with dementia, early stages Alzheimer's or just simple advancing years, these abbreviations are often too confusing to process. This day clock displays complete words only, no abbreviations. This clock bold and clear display is a great for elderly or vision impaired. This quiet reminder clock or 8" digital calendar day clock has the clearest & easiest to read display available. This clock has everything! It displays the full day, cycle of the day, time & date and it's not just for people with memory loss or as a dementia aid. Anyone can enjoy this wonderful clock. It makes a great gift. It's sleek & contemporary design will look great anywhere in your home or office, sitting on your desk or counter or wall mounted for everyone to enjoy. The dementia clock can be viewed as a dementia aid, dementia product or even an Alzheimer's product. It assists dementia patients or early state Alzheimer's patients. This day clock is a self-help tool for people who get confused with abbreviations & with am & pm notations. With no confusing abbreviations. Many seniors suffering from memory loss due to dementia, stroke, Alzheimer's or just advancing years, often have difficulty processing abbreviated words. The preset cycle’s times are: Morning 6:00 am - 11:59 am / afternoon 12:00 noon - 4:59 pm / evening 5:00pm - 8:59 pm / night 9:00pm - 11:59 pm / before dawn 12:00 midnight - 5:59 am.
feature_bullets: This DAYCLOX unique 5 CYCLE DIGITAL CALENDAR DAY CLOCK clearly spells out the full DAY of the Week, CYCLE of the Day, MONTH and DATE in large, bold letters - with no confusing abbreviations. Many seniors suffering from memory loss due to dementia, stroke, Alzheimer's or just advancing years, often have difficulty processing abbreviated words.

Each day is divided into 5 CYCLES, MORNING, AFTERNOON, EVENING, NIGHT & BEFORE DAWN which is perfect for those struggling to differentiate between AM & PM notations. The preset Cycles Times are: Morning 6:00am – 11:59 am / Afternoon 12:00 Noon – 4:59 pm / Evening 5:00pm – 8:59 pm / Night 9:00pm – 11:59 pm / Before Dawn 12:00 midnight – 5:59 am.

BATTERY BACKUP - in the event of a loss of power to the clock, the clock will maintain the correct time internally, without displaying during outages.The accurate time will then display correctly after power is restored or the clock is plugged back in. Clock will clearly display the words BEFORE DAWN from Midnight – 5:59 am. Most other clocks will either display ‘MORNING’, which may result in many seniors getting out of bed to start their day in the wee hours of night.

Great for the ELDERLY, the VISUALLY IMPAIRED & people with Macular Degeneration. The sharp, non-glare clear display can be seen from across the room. IDEAL CLOCK FOR PEOPLE OF ALL AGES! The words Dementia, Alzheimer's or Memory Loss are ‘not’ printed on the clock itself so it makes a great gift for those special loved ones, especially Grandma & Grandpa. It is quickly becoming a perfect Senior Care and In Home Care necessity.

Available in ENGLISH only. Overall Dimensions: 8.5" wide x 6.75" high x 1" deep (4.5" deep with Kickstand) 8" diagonal display screen. Can be easily set to 12 hour or 24 hr (Military Time). This Memory Loss Digital Calendar Day Cycle clock can be used as a Desk clock or Wall clock. The clock requires an A/C adapter (US adapter included) to operate. Does not run on batteries. One Year US warranty - void when used outside USA.
